stories.title: Ask HN: Is there any book like: from ohms law to 8 bit computer

stories.text:
Hi HN ! I would like to build a shell syntax parser and I would like to do it without yacc or tools like that, for learning purposes. I have been reading a lot parsing tutorials and I got a tokenizer working. From what I have read I now either have to make a parse tree or an abstract syntax tree out of my tokens with the help of a grammar from this page [1]

Now can you point me to any good documentation on how to make a tree out of it ?

All the tutorials I could find on the matter are made for arithmetic syntax and somehow I haven't been able to adapt those to my use case.

I have also read article from the creator of Oil shell and talks about how making a modal tokenizer would make sense for the shell syntax but I have not been able to find anything on how to build such a thing. Have ever done one ?

[1] https://pubs.opengroup.org/onlinepubs/9699919799.2018edition/utilities/V3_chap02.html#tag_18_10
stories.title: What is the best way to parse shell-like syntax without a lexer?
